instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message:
Hi -
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had light liquid damage near SMC and <CHIP>U7001</CHIP> but not really much. The board was missing PPBUS, but has been restored. This board will only power on if a battery is connected. Here are the measurements from AC adapter. Green/Amber light present. 85 Watt Original. Thanks.

PPBUS - 12.58V
PP3v42 - 3.428V
PPVRTC - 3.336V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> - 12.58V
PP18vDCIN - 16.6V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5.02V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.35V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_3</SIGNAL> - 0V

Have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: Crap under SMC likely. Is it actually charging the battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: Hey Duke. Reflowed then replaced SMC. It still powers on with battery or battery and charger. Will not power on with charger only. Yes it charges the battery. If I want to power on with only charger I have to use a chinese charger. Weird. Other then that it works totally normal. Have green/Amber on both chargers. Thank you sir.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: That would be a <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> or <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> problem. Not saying the actual FETs are bad it could also be resistors/traces to them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: Just wondering... What allows it to work with a Chinese charger and not allow original charger? Chinese charger works.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: They do not have over current protection. Issue is in the components I mentioned.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message:
Thanks for that...
I have looked into the areas you suggested with no luck so far. I have checked traces, checked resistors in the area and replaced both <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>. With original charger I am getting pulses of 16.60 - 16.80V on the DC-in connector. With the Chinese one I get a steady 16.5V in the same test location. Powers on automatically when magsafe is plugged in with a battery attached.  What can I be missing?

Have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: Measure voltages to both gates of <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> with the Chinese charger. Checked resistance between pins 17/18, 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message:
Hi Duke.

6.11v - 6.25v on <SIGNAL>S_GATE</SIGNAL>
6.21v - 6.29v on <SIGNAL>A_GATE</SIGNAL>


<RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> were off. I replaced them as well as <CAPACITOR>C7120</CAPACITOR> -23. It did turn on once with original charger after replacing the resistors, but hasnt since. Reistance on 17/18 - 3.8Ohm, 27/28 - 20.3Ohms. I replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> again, just to be safe.

Thanks man.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: It could be something on PPBUS that is loading down the charger too much. Can you monitor current on a PSU and compare to a good board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message:
Hey Duke. With original charger tip on PSU?

Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: Doesn't matter, the current protection is in the brick not the lead.
